title: Tapi sees losses widen to £15m as it fights to beat Carpetright
text:
A fledgling flooring seller locked in battle with rival Carpetright has been hit by widening losses as it ploughs cash into expanding.

Tapi – which was set up by the son of Carpetright's founder – lost £15.3m in 2018, worse than a £10.9m loss the previous year.

The firm said it now expects to become profitable in the next two years. Tapi previously predicted it would break even in 2017 and be profitable in 2018.

Tapi was set up in 2015 by Martin Harris, the son of Lord Harris of Peckham, also known as the “carpet king”.

Mr Harris worked at Carpetright for 23 years and he stepped down shortly before his father resigned as chairman in a boardroom dispute.
